page.title: 18CHURCHES
page.content: On Sanday there have been and still are a number of{Church buildings. Within our 3km x 4km block we have {three}such{sites. Two}of the{Churches are{not}now in{use,}both being{ruins. One,{Lady Kirk,}(M.R.678399) is a substantial ruin. The other, the{old {Cross Kirk,}(M.R.655393), down at Backaskail, is a complete ruin (only a few stones left standing). They both have graveyards, being two of the three cemeteries on the island. The third Church in the area is at Broughtown (M.R.659409), the{Cross {Kirk. This Church is used}on alternate Sundays in the summer, alternating with the East Church in Lady, for services, and also during the whole of January, February and March. The Cross Kirk is a small 'one roomed' building, seating 170 people.
